name: National Maternal Mental Health Hotline
description: The National Maternal Mental Health Hotline provides free, confidential, 24/7 support in English and Spanish for pregnant and postpartum individuals experiencing mental health issues. Professional counselors offer emotional support, resources, and referrals to local support groups and healthcare professionals. The hotline is administered by the Health Resources and Services Administration (HRSA) and serves as a vital resource for new and expecting parents.
source: Verified from official HRSA Maternal and Child Health Bureau website
hours_of_operation: 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
eligibility_requirements: Available to pregnant individuals and those who have recently given birth (postpartum)
populations_served: Pregnant and postpartum individuals, new parents, families
cost_information: Free service - no cost to call or text
notes: VERIFIED INFORMATION: All contact information verified on 2025-01-27.
